intro: Scorzonera petrovii, commonly known as the Caucasian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Scorzonera petrovii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
